required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Features and Outcome of Wilson's Disease With Generalized Epilepsy in Chinese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Features and Outcome of Wilson's Disease With Generalized Epilepsy in Chinese Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Generalized epilepsy is rarely reported in patients with Wilson disease (WD) and lacks experience in clinical practice. We aim to provide better experience for the diagnosis and treatment for WD patients with epilepsy in the future.

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective study was performed in 13 Chinese WD patients with generalized epilepsy. Each patient was diagnosed with WD by clinical evaluation and genetic screening. Patients were given small doses of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs), followed by copper-chelation therapy when the seizures stabilized. Clinical manifestations, brain imaging changes, and treatment and outcome after a long-term follow-up were analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment stop seizures attacks
primary_outcome.description: After standard treatment, the patients would stop attacks and get improved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment have improved brain MRI
secondary_outcome.description: After standard treatment, the abnormalities of brain MRI would get better in patients.

arm_group.description: Chinese WD patients with generalized epilepsy

intervention.description: Sanger sequencing and multiplex ligation-dependent probe amplification (MLPA)

study_pop.textblock: Each patient was diagnosed with WD by clinical evaluation and genetic screening. Patients were given small doses of antiepileptic drugs (AEDs), followed by copper-chelation therapy when the seizures stabilized.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Each patient was diagnosed with WD by clinical evaluation and genetic screening and had ever experienced generalized epilepsy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not WD & without generalized epilepsy

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine
